image.altText: Side-by-side images of convicted murderer Greg Lynn and his wife Melanie.

props.synopsis: Police blunders, a judge's ruling that almost torpedoed the case and a possible trip to the crime scene in an army chopper — these are the things the Greg Lynn murder trial jury wasn't told.

title.children: 'She's cackling like a hyena': Why judge kept secret recording of convicted killer Greg Lynn and wife from the jury

image.altText: Terri and Bindi Irwin stand with their arms around each other while Robert Irwin stands on a large rock behind them

props.synopsis: Bindi Irwin's joyous Tasmanian family holiday photos were sure to be on the radar of US celebrity watching media — the trouble is, they don't seem to know the difference between Tasmania and Tanzania, locations which are more than 11,000 kilometres apart.

title.children: Bindi blunder by US celebrity website mistaking Tasmania for Tanzania

image.altText: A plane landing on a tarmac

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese has confirmed that Australian High Commissioner to the UK Stephen Smith is travelling with Julian Assange. Follow live.

title.children: Julian Assange's plane lands in Thailand ahead of court hearing

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Why Saipan?  ABC's European correspondent has a possible answer
Assange's plane touches down in Bangkok
Assange's plane to stop in Bangkok to refuel, Thai officials say

image.altText: A sign outside a beer garden says "James Boag".

props.synopsis: A premium beer deeply associated with Tasmania will move operations for its mainland sales off the island to stem rising costs.

title.children: Iconic beer reliant on 'pure Tasmanian waters' to send production in part to mainland Australia

image.altText: A young woman wearing a grey blazer stands on a stairwell, smiling.

props.synopsis: Kristin Van Wyk is a university student, but she didn't sit an exam for a tertiary admission score. She's a graduate of an alternative model of high school where personal motivation is the main driver behind student retention.

title.children: This school has no exams, and students can still get a place at university

image.altText: Younger Julian sat in front of microphones with a banner reading Human Rights in front of him

props.synopsis: Julian Assange has left the United Kingdom and will plead guilty to espionage. The deal marks a new chapter in a long-running saga that saw a Townsville kid take on the United States Department of Justice.

title.children: Seven years in an embassy, five years in prison, now Julian Assange looks set to come home

image.altText: A courtroom sketch of Greg Lynn

props.synopsis: Former Jetstar pilot Greg Lynn has been found guilty of murdering retiree Carol Clay at a Victorian campsite four years ago, but a jury has acquitted him of murdering fellow camper Russell Hill.

title.children: Greg Lynn guilty of murder of Carol Clay, acquitted over death of Russell Hill — as it happened

image.altText: A dozen young school children standing outside with hats on

props.synopsis: Tasmania has some of the worst education results in the country. A review has been announced to fix it, as the gap between Tasmania and the rest of the country appears to be growing.

title.children: Tasmania scrambling to close education gap with systemic review, as year 12 completion rates continue to drop

image.altText: A composite image of an older man and an older woman smiling.

props.synopsis: Former Jetstar pilot Greg Lynn has faced a weeks-long murder trial over the deaths of two retirees who vanished during a camping trip in Victoria's High Country more than four years ago.

title.children: Campers' families say they're 'relieved and devastated' after Greg Lynn jury delivers split verdict

image.altText: A woman with long dark hair wearing a mustard jacket

props.synopsis: Earlier this month the Fair Work Commission ruled Ms Lattouf had been sacked by the ABC when she was taken off air part way through a radio presenting stint on ABC Radio Sydney last December.

title.children: Antoinette Lattouf's case against ABC to head to federal court after mediation fails

image.altText: A teenage girl with blonde hair holds a mobile phone with both hands, with the phone in focus and her face obscured.

props.synopsis: Cyber safety experts say the ability to create fake sexually explicit images has become frighteningly easy in the last couple of years.

title.children: 'It's an issue for every school': Why sexually explicit deepfakes could become a wider problem

image.altText: A generic photo of two teenage schoolkids sitting side by side, using their phones.

props.synopsis: On the very first day of public hearings for the much-vaunted Joint Select Committee on Social Media and Australian Society, eSafety Commissioner Julie Inman Grant compared banning children younger than 16 from social media to banning them from the ocean.

title.children: Why the eSafety Commissioner is against social media bans, OpenAI's creative jobs clanger, and a U-turn on AI drive-thru

image.altText: A shirtless man with white hair and a white beard is surrounded by a rescue team.

props.synopsis: The 34-year-old hiker has been found after 10 days in the Northern California mountains, where he survived by collecting water in his shoe.

title.children: Lukas McClish got lost in the Northern California mountains. He survived by collecting water in his shoe

image.altText: Myer in The Myer Centre in Brisbane CBD, people walking past

props.synopsis: Solomon Lew has been slowly clawing his way back to the historic retailer, and, if he gets his latest deal across the line, it will pave the way for him to return to the Myer boardroom, this time as chair.

title.children: Solomon Lew may soon be calling Myer 'My'store again

image.altText: Officers in forensics uniforms outside a house.

props.synopsis: Police say they are keeping an "open mind" as they investigate whether a drug overdose caused the deaths of four people found in the living room of a home in Melbourne's north this morning.

title.children: Uncle mourns 'brilliant boy' after 17yo and three others found dead in Melbourne home

image.altText: A small yellow tablet next to a ruler.

props.synopsis: A synthetic opioid — which has been linked to a rise in overdose deaths overseas — has emerged on the illicit drug scene, with some experts warning it has the potential to be Australia's version of a "fentanyl crisis".

title.children: A synthetic opioid stronger than fentanyl and hundreds of times more potent than heroin is emerging in Australia

image.altText: A man and woman sit outdoors looking at the camera with a neutral expression. The woman has her arm around him.

props.synopsis: Ten months after their dream of becoming parents turned to tragedy, these families are still fighting a giant IVF company to find out what went wrong.

title.children: 'We're never gonna forget what happened': The trauma of Amelia and Zach's IVF experience lingers

image.altText: A blue and red cargo ship loaded with hundreds of shipping containers sits in port with cranes visible beside it

props.synopsis: The cargo ship Dali, which crashed into a major Baltimore bridge killing six people, has left port three months after the catastrophe.

title.children: Ship that crashed into Baltimore bridge finally on its way

image.altText: Rashid Khan hugs Gulbadin Naib

props.synopsis: Afghanistan beats Bangladesh in their thrilling Super Eight showdown to progress to its first World Cup semifinal at the expense of Australia.

title.children: Australia knocked out of T20 World Cup as Afghanistan makes historic semifinal with thrilling win

image.altText: Picasso artwork hanging in a toilet cubicle.

props.synopsis: Multiple artworks by Pablo Picasso have been relocated to a female toilet at Hobart's Mona, following an adverse court ruling which found a man was discriminated against when he was turned away from the women-only 'Ladies Lounge'.

title.children: Picasso artworks put in female toilet as part of art gallery response to court ruling

image.altText: Julian Assange with white hair and glasses in a blue shirt reads documents on a couch

props.synopsis: WikiLeaks says its founder, Julian Assange, has been released from prison and has left the United Kingdom, shortly after court documents revealed a plea deal that would allow him to return to Australia.

title.children: Julian Assange freed from UK prison under plea deal with US Justice Department

image.altText: A composite photo of a bearded man giving a thumbs-up and a clean-shaven man wearing a suit.

props.synopsis: Nationals MP Barnaby Joyce warns the "finish line" is not yet reached as politicians from across the political spectrum welcome Julian Assange's departure from the UK after being released from Belmarsh prison.

title.children: PM 'welcomes' Assange news but won't say more until he's home

image.altText: A KFC sign outdoors consisting of a large bucket with the face of Colonel Sanders.

props.synopsis: The Australian share market is trading higher on Tuesday after Collins Foods, the local operator of KFC and Taco Bell in Australia, reported a 500 per cent net profit increase during last financial year. Follow live.

title.children: KFC's local operator sees net profit surge by more than 500 per cent, Australian shares rise

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Will Solomon Lew return to the Myer boardroom?
Consumer sentiment stuck in 'deeply pessimistic' territory

image.altText: A person at a desk with a calculator and lots of receipts in their hand

props.synopsis: About 14 million Australians will be prepping their tax returns over the coming weeks and months come July 1. Here's what you need to know.

title.children: When can I lodge my tax return? Here's the cut-off date to avoid a fine from the ATO

image.altText: Holly Willoughby in a dress standing on a red carpet and smiling as fans stand behind a barrier behind her

props.synopsis: A 37-year-old man plotted to abduct, rape and murder one of Britain's most popular TV personalities, Holly Willoughby, a court has been told.

title.children: Man plotted to 'rape and murder' British TV personality

image.altText: Black and white photo of man wearing suit and glasses, Robert Bauman, standing next to older man and woman.

props.synopsis: It's easy to forget that Donald Trump's entry to politics came via a gay Republican group. The "Gay Right" has played a defining role in conservative US politics for decades.

title.children: Two gay men helped shape America's modern conservative movement. They were leading a double life

image.altText: A scientist testing a pill-like substance.

props.synopsis: Pill testing will be rolled out across 10 Victorian festivals this summer and a fixed site will be established in the city in a bid to decrease drug overdoses.

title.children: 'We need to accept the evidence': Victorian government outlines details of pill testing trial

image.altText: Man looking at a phone with maps open on the screen

props.synopsis: A report by the NSW Crime Commission finds tracking devices are now part of standard toolkit for violent organised crime and their widespread use by domestic and family violence offenders is an urgent issue.

title.children: One in four people who purchased GPS tracking devices since 2023 have a history of DV, report finds

image.altText: A painting of a woman in an old fashioned dress tuning a lute, she has one breast bared

props.synopsis: From Mozart's "trademark bawdy flair" to the erotic poem in the Bible, sex has always been part of classical music. You just have to know where to look.

title.children: Did you know that Mozart wrote dirty songs? In fact, there's a lot of smut in classical music

image.altText: Bandt vapes composite

props.synopsis: Adam Bandt insists his party is focused on harm reduction after it struck a deal to allow any adult to buy vapes from pharmacists.

title.children: Greens deny they have watered down government vaping laws

image.altText: a crowd of people watch an artist perform on stage at night

props.synopsis: Sunshine Coast Council confirm they will no longer fund the festival, which has been a favourite for music lovers since 2007.

title.children: Caloundra Music Festival cancelled for good as Council pull funding for event

image.altText: a woman walks past an abandoned bank

props.synopsis: Australia's banking watchdog has publicly sanctioned Westpac over the bank's sudden branch closure in the isolated Northern Territory town of Tennant Creek.

title.children: Banking watchdog finds Westpac guilty of 'serious breaches' over sudden closure of remote NT branch

image.altText: A woman wearing ripped jeans and black tank sits on a couch, looking at phone and drinking tea.

props.synopsis: It's understandable to feel nervous about having a laparoscopy for endometriosis. Knowing what is involved can help ease your mind.

title.children: Tips to prepare for a laparoscopy for endometriosis

image.altText: An Indigenous woman and a toddler look at the camera for a photo.

props.synopsis: The trial of Donna Nelson, the former Greens candidate accused of smuggling drugs into Japan, is delayed just two days before it was due to commence, with some of her family already en route to the country.

title.children: WA grandmother's trial for allegedly importing 1.9kg of drugs into Japan delayed at last minute

image.altText: A graphic of male and female characters against a wooden background.

props.synopsis: Legal experts want the federal government to foot the bill for child support if an ex-partner doesn't pay, with new data revealing last financial year 168,000 parents had overdue tax returns.

title.children: Parents failing to submit tax returns are skewing child support payments
